accept kingdom ramirus therefore left monastery married wife daughter called vrraca neither conjugal affection desire kingdom two strongest bond amongst men able retain would return unto ecclesiastical humility experienced convent formerly lived parthian civil discord ejected artabanus king fulgos ex l c pag ioseph antiq l c p endeavoured restauration kingdom arm iazates king adiabeni parthian upon account imminent war moved also reason repented expelled artabanus sent therefore ambassador iazates giving understand would willingly require upon expulsion artabanus set cynamus stead sworn allegiance unto king durst recede oath cynamus understood wrote artabanus iazates come would resign kingdom parthia artabanus come cynamus went forth meet adorned royal robe diadem upon head assoon drew near artabanus dismounting horse thus spake parthian driven thee artabanus kingdom resolved confer another intreaty received soon knew desire restore thee true lawful king hindrance without consent forbare oppose thou seest mine accord without respect restore thee said took diadem head hand fitted artabanus freely returned former privacy albertus dominick fryer syms ch hist l cent p great learning sirnamed magnus made bishop ratisbone pope alexander fourth freely left bishoprick returned home colen might retire enjoy greater quiet reading writing penis humfr burt year lord upon foolish confidence heaven either inadvertence impotency k owl turk hist p april turk lent good sum money christian paid certain day came appointed day another turk willed christian pay money turk day came christian promised performed accordingly turk denied receipt thereof whereupon money properly due came demanded christian answered paid party assigned whereunto turk replied satisfied yet turk denied whereupon matter brought judge turk received money taking oath contrary christian according turkish justice enforced pay money withal prayed god shew publick sign done wrong thereupon turk
